block.p: Senate Republican leaders took one look at the famous photograph of an immigration agent holding a submachine gun near a cowering Elian Gonzalez and rushed to call hearings into the Little Havana raid. But after public opinion surveys showed vast support for the raid, they softened their language and uncharacteristically retreated from a public inquiry. Most senators now say the inquiry is best handled on paper, behind closed doors.
